results.title: Cherry Falls [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Wright, Eli Selden, Marshall Persinger and Rouge Pictures
results.brief_description: Australian director Geoffrey Wright made his American debut with this skewered take on the teen slasher film. Set in the quintessential American small town, “Cherry Falls” takes the convention of horror movies that only virgins can escape the killer’s knife and turns it on its head. When an unknown predator starts murdering teenage virgins, the town sheriff, (Michael Biehn) who has a teenage daughter of his own (Brittany Murphy), calls a general meeting amongst the concerned parents to combat the problem. The town’s teenagers however come up with their own solution; a ‘lose your virginity party’. Meanwhile, the body count rises, parents become delirious with fear and the kids get more and more frisky. “Cherry Falls” eventually descends into familiar formula but along the way offers some subversive moments like a father encouraging his young daughter to ‘go all the way’ with her boyfriend and father daughter relationships that are laced with incestuous desire. Cast includes: Jay Mohr, Candy Clark.

results.title: Chernobyl: Counting the Cost
results.brief_description: In 1986, the world witnessed its worst civil nuclear accident when one of the reactors at the Chernobyl nuclear power station exploded during safety exercises. The consequences of that accident confirmed the dangers associated with radiation. Inhabitants of the villages surrounding the Chernobyl zone have been resettled, and the health of many regularly monitored. However, the full impact of this tragedy will only be revealed as illness, death and the long-term environmental consequences are exposed with time.

results.title: Cherchez L'idole = Look for the Idol
results.brief_description:
A young man is pushed into a dare by a girlfriend and has to steal a piece of jewellery. Interrupted in the act by nosy neighbors, he must abandon the gems in a guitar at a music shop. When he returns later to get hold of the jewels, the guitar has been sold. Musical performances by the ‘pop idols’ of the era: Charles Aznavour, Nancy Holloway, Johnny Hallyday, Sylvie Vartan and Frank Alamo.

Credits: Producer, Mario Chabert ; director, Michel Boisrond ; writers, Annette Wademant, Michel Balducci ; photography, Raymond Lemoigne ; music, Georges Garvarentz.
Cast: Frank Fernandel, Berthe Granval, Dany Saval, Mylene Demongeot, Johnny Halliday.

results.title: Cheek to cheek
results.creator_credit: Beth Armstrong, Strong Arm Films and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: When her uncommunicative, elderly husband dies suddenly after choking on an Anzac biscuit, Beryl casts off her bereavement to rediscover pleasures she had lost touch with in the latter years of her marriage, such as swimming in the sea, tap dancing, chocolate and foolish games. The catalyst for her reinvigoration so late in life is her little dog, who metamorphosises before her eyes only, into a frisky, carefree older woman. The pair become inseparable playmates much to the consternation of Beryl’s uptight daughter who sees only a spoilt dog and fears for her mother’s sanity. A film that touches on universal themes such as life after death of a loved one, caring for the aged, discovering your other half and taking control of your own happiness. Cast includes Melissa Jaffer, Tina Bursill, Maggie Blinco and Georgina Naidui.

results.title: Check-in time
results.creator_credit: Karl Holtsnider, Bernard Selling and Franciscan Communications Center
results.brief_description: A film which is only incidentally about alcoholism but is, more importantly, about covenant and how one family understands it. Looks at the strengths and weaknesses of a family where the father is an alcoholic, and the way the family confronts the problem.

results.title: Chaval
results.brief_description:
A valedictory film to the French humorist and cartoon cine-montage maker Chaval, little-known outside of France but revered in his homeland. Includes extracts from his films ‘Metamorphosis’, ‘Dessin’ and ‘The Good Book’. Chaval committed suicide in 1968.

Credits: Producer, Anatole Dauman ; director, Mario Ruspoli ; writer (narration), Georges Wolinski.
Cast: Pascal Mazzotti.

results.title: Chase that dream
results.creator_credit: Ken Cameron, Tom Manefield, Australia. Dept. of Housing and Construction and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Shows the difficulties faced by low income earners in trying to save money to buy their own home or even rent decent premises. Emphasises how important housing is in people’s lives and how a decision taken at one stage affects their ability to get suitable housing later. Cast includes Laurel McGowan, Peter Fisher, Harry Lawrence, Alan Penney, May Howlett, Gary Files. Credits also include camera; Dean Semler and music; John Gillard.

results.title: Chasing Amy [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Kevin Smith, Scott Mosier, Miramax Films and View Askew Productions
results.brief_description: The concluding chapter of Kevin Smith’s New Jersey Trilogy, “Chasing Amy” is a comedy about Holden, a successful comic-book creator, whose life takes a turn when he falls madly in love with Alyssa, a fellow artist. The first major shock awaiting Holden is Alyssa’s apparent lesbian orientation. The second one comes after the two develop a strong friendship, and Alyssa decides not to limit her chances of love to women only. The two begin an affair, despite Holden’s nagging doubts about her promiscuous past. Cast includes Ben Affleck, Joey Lauren Adams, Jason Lee, Dwight Ewell, Jason Mewes and Kevin Smith.

results.title: Charting the universe with optical and radio telescopes
results.creator_credit: David Bennett and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explains and illustrates instruments and methods used by astronomers. Describes work of radio astronomers and astrophysicists in search of facts about the universe. Shows cooperation between different observatories in solving mysteries of outer space. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Charro !
results.creator_credit: Charles M. Warren and National General Pictures
results.brief_description: In Elvis’ 29th film he plays it straight in a Western written and directed by the creator of “Gunsmoke”, “Rawhide” and “The Virginian”. Elvis is cast as ex-outlaw Jess Wade, a man determined to stick to the straight and narrow and reform his ways. Wade is captured by his former band of outlaws. The gang then goes on to terrorise a small town by threatening to use an ornate Mexican canon on the village - a canon which Wade is falsely accused of stealing from the Mexican revolutionary forces. Cast also includes Ina Balin, Victor French, Barbara Werle and Lynn Kellogg. Elvis sings only one song in the movie.
